question: The reducing agent in the given equations:
$4 Ag_{(s)}+8 CN_{(aq)}^{-}+2H_{2}O_{(aq)}+O_{2_{(g)}}\rightarrow4[Ag(CN)_{2}]_{(aq)}^{-}+4 OH_{(aq)}^{-}$
$2[Ag(CN)_{2}]_{(aq)}^{-}+Zn_{(s)}\rightarrow[Zn(CN)_{4}]_{(aq)}^{2-}+2Ag_{(s)}$
explanation: In the second step, Zinc (Zn) displaces Silver (Ag).
Zn goes from oxidation state 0 to +2 (Oxidation).
Zn causes the reduction of Ag+ to Ag, acting as the reducing agent.
